content.raw: I've split out the two patches. The URDF part is in pull request #77 while the gtest part is in branch [use_external_gtest_flag](#!/osrf/sdformat/branch/use_external_gtest_flag). Ubuntu does not provide a binary for google test nor a cmake or pkgconfig finder. I'm supposing that fedora is currently doing that so you can use the ```find_package(GTest)```. It would need a bit more of work to make it able to find debian/ubuntu files and compile them.
content.html: I've split out the two patches. The URDF part is in pull request #77 while the gtest part is in branch use_external_gtest_flag. Ubuntu does not provide a binary for google test nor a cmake or pkgconfig finder. I'm supposing that fedora is currently doing that so you can use the find_package(GTest). It would need a bit more of work to make it able to find debian/ubuntu files and compile them.
